block.p: Larry Nelson and Leonard Thompson shot six-under-par 66's yesterday to share the first-round lead in the Senior PGA Tour's Boone Valley Classic in Augusta, Mo.
Nelson, the 1998 winner, had six birdies in a bogey-free round on the rain-soaked Boone Valley Country Club course.
Larry Nelson and Leonard Thompson shot six-under-par 66's yesterday to share the first-round lead in the Senior PGA Tour's Boone Valley Classic in Augusta, Mo.
Nelson, the 1998 winner, had six birdies in a bogey-free round on the rain-soaked Boone Valley Country Club course.
Thompson had an eagle, six birdies and two bogeys.

EATON'S TEAM WINS WILSON CUP: Ace Eaton's eagle on the par-5 second playoff hole enabled him and his teammate Barry Powlishen of Sterling Farms to defeat Wells Whitfield and Phil Wright and capture the Wilson Cup yesterday at the Scarsdale (N.Y.) Golf Club.
The two teams finished at eight-under-par 136 in the best-ball tournament, named in memory of Charles Wilson, defense mobilizer in World War II and the Korean War.
In the second hole of the playoff, Eaton, who will compete in the United States Open sectional qualifying on June 6, drove 275 feet and used a 7- iron to get within 18 feet of the cup.
He then putted for the eagle. During regulation play he had seven birdies, five of them in the second round.
